policyID.description: A pointer to the case and/or policy that this payment method is associated with.

effectiveDate.description: The first day that this payment method is (allowed to be) used.

endDate.description:
The last day that this payment method is (allowed to be) used. 
Do not provide a value for this field if this payment method is expected to be used indefinitely.

formOfPayment.description: The credit/debit or bank account information needed to process a payment with this payment method.

autopaySetup.description:
The information needed to set up automatically recurring payments. 
Missing values indicate that automatically recurring payments are not enabled for this payment method.

License.description: A government-regulated license, which grants an agent permission to legally sell insurance in a particular geographical region (i.e. state).

agentID.description: A pointer to the full contact record of the agent to whom this license belongs.

status.description: The current status this license, in relation to its legal validity (e.g. current, pending, or expired).

isResidentialLicense.description: True indicates that this is an agent's residential license (i.e. the one that allows the agent to sell insurance in the state where they live).

licenseNumber.description: The state-assigned license number (i.e. a combination of letters and numbers that the state government uses to uniquely identify the license).

effectiveDate.description: The date on which the license was issued.

expirationDate.description: The date on which the license expires.

state.description: The state for which the license was issued.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this quote or illustration.

runDate.description: The date on which this quote or illustration was run (i.e. calculated by the quote/illustration preparation system).

documentID.description: A pointer to the document version of this quote or illustration.

status.description:
The current status of this quote or illustration. 
    
Indicates how far along this quote/illustration is in the process of becoming a case.

carrier.description: The insurance company that ran this quote or illustration.

agentID.description: A pointer to the unique identifier for the agent who is selling the product featured in this quote or illustration.

productID.description: A pointer to the unique identifier for the product requested in this quote or illustration.

caseID.description: A pointer to the case that this quote or illustration is a precursor to, should the quote/illustration be successfully converted into a case.

proposedClient.description: The person for whom this quote/illustration was prepared (i.e. the person requesting insurance coverage).

age.description:
The age of the `proposedClient` at the time that the quote/illustration was run. 

This value is less precise than `DOB` (date of birth). Generally, a quote has either the `currentClientAge` or `DOB` but not both.

rateClass.description: A category indicating the overall health of the `proposedClient` (e.g. Preferred Non Smoker, Preferred Plus, Standard, etc).  Rate class has a direct impact on the price of the life insurance policy.

modalPremium.description:
The amount of money the `proposedClient` will pay in premium when they receive their bill, should they select this quote. 

The frequency at which the `proposedClient` will pay the `modalPremium` is called the `paymentMode`.

paymentMode.description:
The frequency at which the `proposedClient` will be expected to pay the premium on their policy (e.g. Monthly, Quarterly, Semi-annually, or Annually), should they select this quote. 

Note: The amount of money payable each time the `proposedClient` receives their bill is the called the `modalPremium`.

faceAmount.description: The quoted amount of money paid out to the beneficiary when the insured dies. Typically used on Term policies (as opposed to Universal Life, Whole Life, or Annuity policies). Sometimes referred to as death benefit.

deathBenefit.description:
The quoted amount of money paid out to the beneficiary when the insured or annuitant dies. Typically used in Whole Life, Universal Life, or Annuities (as opposed to Term Life).

`deathBenefit` may differ from `faceAmount` in that `deathBenefit` may change over time, while `faceAmount` stays the same over the lifetime of a policy. The value of `deathBenefit` often changes because adjustments (e.g. the accrual of interest) are made to it over the lifetime of the policy.

Requirement.description: A requirement associated with a case.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this requirement.

caseID.description: A pointer to the case that this requirement is associated with.

name.description: The name of the requirement (i.e. the task that must be completed).

comment.description:
The additional information needed to understand or appropriately complete the requirement.

For example, if the requirement is a Blood Test, the `comment` may say, “ Must fast for 12 hours before this blood test”.

responsibleParty.description:
The individual or entity responsible for the completion of the task specified in this requirement. 
For example, if the requirement is related to and issue with missing or inaccurate licensing information, the `responsibleParty` is the agent that has must provide accurate license information to the carrier.

requestedDate.description: The date on which the carrier sent out a notification requesting that this requirement be completed.

scheduledDate.description:
The date on which the task requested by the carrier is scheduled to be completed. 
For example, if the requirement is a medical examination request,
the `scheduledDate` is the date of the insured’s doctor’s appointment.

receivedDate.description: The date on which the carrier receives evidence that the requirement has been completed.

status.description:
The current status of the requirement (i.e. where the task is  on its journey towards completion). 

Examples include, but are not limited to: pending, scheduled, received, outstanding

statusDate.description: The date on which the `status` of this requirement was last updated by the carrier.

blankFormID.description: A pointer to the blank copy of the form or questionnaire that must be filled out in order to fulfill this requirement.

documentIDs.description: A collection pointers to completed documents that are related to this requirement (e.g. filled-out questionnaires, medical records, etc.).

category.description: A category that is used to group requirements by how or when they are needed during the application process (e.g. Obtain At Delivery, Needed for Underwriting).

Rider.description: A rider (i.e. additional benefit or coverage) applied to the policy.

name.description: The name of the rider (e.g. Child Term Rider, Waiver of Premium, etc.).

riderValue.description:
The total amount of money that the rider is worth (as additional benefit). 
 
 The `riderValue` can be different than the `faceAmount` of the base policy the rider is tied to.

modalPremium.description:
The amount of money the policyowner pays for the rider each time premium is due (at a frequency set by the `premiumMode`). `modalPremium` is only applicable for premium that is paid separately from the base policy premium. 
 
 Note: this value is NOT applicable to inherent riders (i.e. riders that are include as part of the base policy).

premiumMode.description:
The frequency at which the rider `modalPremium` is paid (e.g. Monthly, Quarterly, Annually, etc.). 

Note: this value is NOT applicable to inherent riders (i.e. riders that are included as part of the base policy).

annualPremium.description: The total amount of money that the policyowner pays in premium for the rider over the course of a year.

status.description:
The current status of the rider. Examples include, but are not limited to: Cancelled, Active, Exercised, Inactive.

The status of a rider can be different from the status of the policy that it is attached to.

statusDate.description: The date on which the carrier most recently updated the rider's `status`.

termConversionDate.description: The last day to convert a term rider into a permanent rider. Often referred to as the term conversion expiration date.

eligibilityDate.description: The date on which when the rider is eligible to be exercised by the insured (i.e. when the insured can begin taking advantage of the additional coverage or benefits that the rider provides).

policyID.description: A pointer to the case and/or policy that this rider is tied to.

contactIDs.description: A collection of IDs for the full contact records for the people related to the rider.

items.description: A unique identifier for a full contact record for a person.

BoundParty.description: A party that is bound to a particular user based on authorization logic.

ID.description: A pointer to the full contact record of this bound party.

partyNumber.description: A combination of letters and numbers that the carrier uses to uniquely identify this bound party.

name.description: The name of the individual or organization this bound party belongs to. For organizations, use the `fullName` option.

partyType.description: The type of individual or organization this bound party represents.

carrier.description: The carrier that this bound party is affiliated with.

User.description: A user record along with the party bindings that this user holds.

ID.description: A unique identifier for this user.

profilePartyID.description: A pointer to the full contact record containing information for this user's profile.

name.description: The name of this user. For organizations, use the `fullName` option.

LinkedParty.description: A party that is linked to at least one user via carrier authorization logic. Each linked party is one which a user is authorized to view or impersonate. Note: A user’s collection of linked parties includes their bound parties (parties which the user can directly act as).

ID.description: A pointer to the full contact record of this linked party.

partyNumber.description: A combination of letters and numbers that the carrier uses to uniquely identify this linked party.

name.description: The name of the individual or organization this linked party represents.

partyType.description: The type of individual or organization this linked party represents.

carrier.description: The carrier that this linked party is affiliated with.

CaseSearchFields.description: The name of a data field (e.g. the name of a column in a relational database).

PolicySearchFields.description: The name of a data field (e.g. the name of a column in a relational database).

field.description: The name of the field that the user chooses to filter against.

operator.description:
A logical operator to return records based on whether _any value exists_ in a user-specified field.

For example, the `empty` operator can be used to search for all records that do not have _any value_ in the `policyNumber` field .

field.description: The name of the string field the user chooses to filter against.

operator.description:
A logical operator used to perform string comparison.

For example, the `contains` operator can be used to search for all records where the string "Abc123" appears somewhere within the `policyNumber` field.

value.description: The user-specified string to used to create the filter.

field.description: The name of the numeric field the user chooses to filter against.

operator.description:
A logical operator used to perform numeric comparison.

  For example, the `lte` operator can be used to search for all records that have a value less than or equal to 10,000 the `policyNumber` field.

value.description: The user-specified number used to create the filter.

field.description: The name of the date field the user chooses to filter against.

operator.description:
A logical operator used for date comparison.

For example, the `before` operator can be used to search for all records that have date prior to Dec 31, 2000 in the `effectiveDate` field.

value.description:
The user-specified Date or DateTime value to create the filter in ISO 8601 format __without timezone__.

**For Date-only filtering** (Properties that represent only a date, without a time component):
- Format: 'YYYY-MM-DD' (e.g., `2024-01-15`)
- Compares only the date portion (year, month, day)
- Ignores time component.

**For DateTime filtering** (Properties that represent both a date and time):
- Format: ISO 8601 string (e.g., `"2024-01-15T10:30:00.000"`)
- Provides millisecond-precision filtering
- Enables precise timestamp without timezone comparison.

The system automatically detects the format and applies the appropriate comparison logic.

field.description: The name of the field the user chooses to filter against.

operator.description:
A logical operator to check for membership within a collection of values.

For example, the `in` operator can be used to search for all records that have data in the `policyNumber` field that matches at least one of the `values` specified by the user.

values.description:
The collection of user-specified values used to create the filter.

For example, if the user specifies 30 different policy numbers as different `values`, the filter will return only records with data in the`policyNumber` field that matches at least one of those 30 policy numbers.

field.description: The name of the field to compare the filter range against.

operator.description:
A logical operator user to check for whether records include a value within the user-specified range.

For example, the `between` operator can be used to search for all records that have a value in the `effectiveDate` field between `2024-01-31` and `2025-01-31`.

range.description: A collection of exactly two user-specified values: one for the upper bound of the range, the other for the lower bound.

field.description: The name of the field the user chooses to filter against. Users may assign each field an optional `boost` value to rank the importance of that field in the search results.

operator.description: TODO...

term.description: The text that is matched against field values during the search. The search term may consist of a single word or multiple words

searchType.description:
The method for matching the search term against field values:
 - `keyword` searches for individual search term words independently from each other.
 - `phrase`  searches for the entire text of the search term together as a contiguous string.
Deprecated: We automatically detect whether to search by keyword or phrase based on the presence of spaces in the search term.

boost.description: A value from 1 to 10 used to rank the importance of a given field relative to other fields during a given search.

resourceType.description: The kind of record or business object that the user chooses to search for (e.g. the user only wants the search to return records that are Policies).

operator.description: A logical operator used to combine filters.

BaseAggregation.description: A base aggregation that can be extended to create specific kinds of aggregations.

name.description: A user-specified name for the aggregation, used to reference it in the response.

field.description: The name of the field this aggregation is being performed against.

NestedAggregation.description:
Enables recursive nesting of aggregations within bucket aggregations (Terms and Date Histogram).

Nested aggregations allow you to perform sub-aggregations on the results of a parent aggregation. For example, you can group records by product type (Terms aggregation), and within each product type bucket, further group by status (nested Terms aggregation), or calculate statistics on premium amounts (nested Stats aggregation).

**Important:** This schema supports circular references. Each item in the `aggregations` array can be any of the following aggregation types, which themselves may contain further nested `aggregations`:
- **TermAggregation**: Groups records by distinct values in a string field
- **DateHistogramAggregation**: Groups records by time intervals (year, month, week, day)
- **StatsAggregation**: Calculates statistical metrics (min, max, avg, sum, count) - cannot contain nested aggregations

The API supports recursive nesting up to 10 levels deep to prevent performance issues and stack overflow errors.

aggregations.description:
An optional array of nested aggregations to perform within each group of the parent aggregation.

Each nested aggregation follows the same structure as top-level aggregations and must include:
- `name`: A unique identifier for the aggregation
- `type`: The aggregation type (terms, dateHistogram, or stats)
- `field`: The field to aggregate on
- `aggregations`: (optional) Further nested aggregations for Terms and Date Histogram types

Nested aggregations enable multi-dimensional data analysis, allowing you to drill down into your data hierarchically.

items.description: An aggregation object. Can be a TermAggregation, DateHistogramAggregation, or StatsAggregation. See the parent schema description for details on the circular reference structure.

type.description:
The **Terms** aggregation returns the number of records that have a particular value in a given string-field.

For example, a terms aggregation against the `product` field may show that there are 20 records for Product A and 50 records of Product B.

Only available for string-based fields.

The **Date Histogram** aggregation returns the number of records with a date value falling within a given time period (`dateInterval`). Users can choose whether to group records by year, month, week, or day. 

For example. a Date Histogram against the `effectiveDate` field (with a `dateInterval` of `year`) may show that there are 1000 records with an `effectiveDate` between Jan 28, 1999 and Jan 28, 2000, and 2000 records between Jan 28, 2000 and Jan 28, 2001.

Only available for date-based fields.

dateInterval.description: A user-chosen duration used to create groups of equal duration in date histogram aggregations.

type.description:
The **Stats** aggregation returns the maximum value, minimum value, sum of values, and arithmetic mean of values present in a given numeric field, as well as the number of records with values in that field.

For example. a Stats aggregation against the `modalPremium` field may show that there are 20,000 records with any value in the `modalPremium` field, that the average value is $300, the maximum value is $12,000, the minimum value is $75, and the sum of all values is $6,000,000.

Only available for number-based fields.

PolicySearchResult.description: A record that matches the search criteria.

resourceType.description: The kind of record or business object the user chose to search for.

policy.description: A policy that matches the search criteria.

roles.description: A collection of roles associated with this policy.

contacts.description: A collection of contact records for people, companies, estates, charities and/or trusts associated with this policy.

roles.description: A collection of roles associated with this case.

contacts.description: A collection of contact records for people, companies, estates, charities and/or trusts associated with this case.

operator.description:
A logical operator to return records based on whether _any value exists_ in a user-specified field.

For example, the `empty` operator can be used to search for all records that do not have _any value_ in the `policyNumber` field .

field.description: The name of the string field the user chooses to filter against.

operator.description:
A logical operator used to perform string comparison.

For example, the `contains` operator can be used to search for all records where the string "Abc123" appears somewhere within the `policyNumber` field.

value.description: The user-specified string to used to create the filter.

field.description: The name of the numeric field the user chooses to filter against.

operator.description:
A logical operator used to perform numeric comparison.

  For example, the `lte` operator can be used to search for all records that have a value less than or equal to 10,000 the `policyNumber` field.

value.description: The user-specified number used to create the filter.

field.description: The name of the date field the user chooses to filter against.

operator.description:
A logical operator used for date comparison.

For example, the `before` operator can be used to search for all records that have date prior to Dec 31, 2000 in the `effectiveDate` field.

value.description:
The user-specified Date or DateTime value to create the filter in ISO 8601 format __without timezone__.

**For Date-only filtering** (Properties that represent only a date, without a time component):
- Format: 'YYYY-MM-DD' (e.g., `2024-01-15`)
- Compares only the date portion (year, month, day)
- Ignores time component.

**For DateTime filtering** (Properties that represent both a date and time):
- Format: ISO 8601 string (e.g., `"2024-01-15T10:30:00.000"`)
- Provides millisecond-precision filtering
- Enables precise timestamp without timezone comparison.

The system automatically detects the format and applies the appropriate comparison logic.

field.description: The name of the field the user chooses to filter against.

operator.description:
A logical operator to check for membership within a collection of values.

For example, the `in` operator can be used to search for all records that have data in the `policyNumber` field that matches at least one of the `values` specified by the user.

values.description:
The collection of user-specified values used to create the filter.

For example, if the user specifies 30 different policy numbers as different `values`, the filter will return only records with data in the`policyNumber` field that matches at least one of those 30 policy numbers.

field.description: The name of the field to compare the filter range against.

operator.description:
A logical operator user to check for whether records include a value within the user-specified range.

For example, the `between` operator can be used to search for all records that have a value in the `effectiveDate` field between `2024-01-31` and `2025-01-31`.

range.description: A collection of exactly two user-specified values: one for the upper bound of the range, the other for the lower bound.

field.description: The name of the field the user chooses to filter against. Users may assign each field an optional `boost` value to rank the importance of that field in the search results.

operator.description: TODO...

term.description: The text that is matched against field values during the search. The search term may consist of a single word or multiple words

searchType.description:
The method for matching the search term against field values:
 - `keyword` searches for individual search term words independently from each other.
 - `phrase`  searches for the entire text of the search term together as a contiguous string.
Deprecated: We automatically detect whether to search by keyword or phrase based on the presence of spaces in the search term.

boost.description: A value from 1 to 10 used to rank the importance of a given field relative to other fields during a given search.

operator.description: A logical operator used to combine filters.

components-schemas-BaseAggregation.description: A base aggregation that can be extended to create specific kinds of aggregations.

name.description: A user-specified name for the aggregation, used to reference it in the response.

field.description: The name of the field this aggregation is being performed against.

type.description:
The **Terms** aggregation returns the number of records that have a particular value in a given string-field. 

For example, a terms aggregation against the `product` field may show that there are 20 records for Product A and 50 records of Product B.

Only available for string-based fields.

The **Date Histogram** aggregation returns the number of records with a date value falling within a given time period (`dateInterval`). Users can choose whether to group records by year, month, week, or day. 

For example. a Date Histogram against the `effectiveDate` field (with a `dateInterval` of `year`) may show that there are 1000 records with an `effectiveDate` between Jan 28, 1999 and Jan 28, 2000, and 2000 records between Jan 28, 2000 and Jan 28, 2001.

Only available for date-based fields.

dateInterval.description: A user-chosen duration used to create groups of equal duration in date histogram aggregations.

type.description:
The **Stats** aggregation returns the maximum value, minimum value, sum of values, and arithmetic mean of values present in a given numeric field, as well as the number of records with values in that field.

For example. a Stats aggregation against the `modalPremium` field may show that there are 20,000 records with any value in the `modalPremium` field, that the average value is $300, the maximum value is $12,000, the minimum value is $75, and the sum of all values is $6,000,000.

Only available for number-based fields.

2XX.description: Successful response with application questions and answers history.

schema.description: A collection of applications.

questionGroups.description:
A collection of question groups. 

Note: Questions belonging to the same group are not guaranteed to be returned in any particular order.
Use the  `sequence` property to order questions relative to each other. Questions belonging to the same group have a contiguous `sequence`. In other words, `sequence` property values are consecutive for questions within a particular `questionGroup` .

questions.description:
A collection of all questions from applications.

Questions belonging to the same group have a contiguous `sequence`.

schema.description: A collection of cases.

cases.description: The collection of cases which the requester has access to.

components-responses-2XX.description: A successful response MAY return agent compensation data, grouped by policy.

schema.description: Summary.

commissions.description: A collection of commission transactions that the requester is authorized to view

puddle_commission_statements_components-.description: A successful response MAY return the statements associated with a given agentID.

schema.description: Commission statements for the given agent/agency.

statements.description: A collection of statements for the given agent/agency.

schema.description:
A collection of all contacts (including people, corporations, estates, charities and trusts) associated with a given insurance policy, including:

- Writing and servicing agents/advisors**
- Agency that agents/advisors** are working with
- Any insureds on the policy (including primary or joint)
- Clients - (i.e. the insured, annuitant or policy owner)
- Policyowners (multiples MAY exist)
- Policy payers (multiples MAY exist)
- Beneficiaries (multiples MAY exist)
- Case manager
- Underwriter

*Note: "agent" and "advisor" mean the same thing*

contacts.description: A collection of contact records for people, companies, estates, charities and/or trusts.

documents.description:
A collection of document references, similar to catalog cards at a library. Each reference includes various identifiers for the document, as well as information about how the document is categorized. 
Any and all types of documents may be referenced, including but not limited to:
  blank forms, advertising materials, contact information sheets, filled-in policy documents, underwriting paperwork, commissions statements, claims, etc.

categories.description: The collection of categories which the document belongs to (e.g. Policy Service Forms, Marketing & Sales Materials, Company & Contracting Info, Needs Analysis & Prospecting Letters, Underwriting, Claims, New Business Applications & Forms).

puddle_document_download_components-resp.description: A successful response MAY return a document file.

puddle_financial_activities_components-r.description: A successful response MAY return a collection of policy financials.

schema.description: A collection of

financials.description:
A collection of historical financial activity line-items.

Examples include, but are not limited to: premium payments, cash value changes, and changes in interest rate.

puddle_fund_allocations_components-respo.description: A successful response for fund allocations.

schema.description: A collection of fund allocations.

fundAllocations.description: A catalog detailing how money within a policy has been distributed across different investment options. Includes a collection of individual line-item fund allocations.

schema.description:
A collection of keycards. 
A keycard is a tool that grants a user access a particular set of records.

myKeycards.description: The collection of keycards that directly belong to the logged-in user.

otherKeycards.description: The collection of keycards that the logged-in user is authorized to use.

puddle_notes_components-responses-2XX.description: A successful response MAY return a collection of policy IDs, and a collection of notes associated with each policy ID.

notes.description: A collection of miscellaneous messages associated with a case or policy.

schema.description: A collection of payment methods (i.e. credit/debit cards and/or bank accounts).

paymentMethods.description: The collection of payment methods that the requester has access to.

schema.description: A collection of policies.

policies.description: A collection of policies that the requester has access to.

puddle_products_components-responses-2XX.description: A successful response MAY return the collection of products and product types.

schema.title: Products
schema.description: A collection of products and product types.

types.description: A collection of product types. A product's type is the group or category which that product belongs to. Product `types` are used to categorize products into a hierarchical tree structure (i.e. a categorization tree with parent types such as Life and Annuity, and sub-types such as Whole Life, Term, etc.).

parentID.description: A pointer to the `ID` field of this type's parent type (i.e. the product type which this product type is nested below or is a subtype of). Top-level product types do not have a parent type.

products.description: A collection of products (e.g. Whole Life Insurance, Single Premium Deferred Annuity (SPDA), Term Insurance).

typeID.description: A unique identifier for this product's type. This identifier is used to categorize the product within a hierarchical tree structure of product types (i.e. a categorization tree with parent types such as Life and Annuity, and sub-types such as Whole Life, Term, etc.).

name.description: The name of the company/carrier that sells this product (e.g. SureCo).

carrierCode.description: A combination of letters and numbers that the carrier uses to uniquely identify the company that sells this product.

schema.description: A set of qualifications that the requester has access to. Qualifications are only applicable to agents. Currently qualifications are limited to licenses.

licenses.description: A collection of licenses, each of which grant an agent permission to legally sell insurance in a particular geographical region (i.e. state).

quotes.description: A collection of quotes that have already been created.

schema.description: A collection of requirements.

requirements.description: A collection of requirements (i.e. tasks that must be completed in order for a case/application to become an active policy).

schema.description: A collection of roles.
A collection of riders.
The Agent Profile includes agent details, such as relevant addresses.

profile.description: The profile information for this user.

userID.description: A unique identifier for this user.

userNumber.description: A combination of letters and numbers that the carrier uses to uniquely identify this user.

name.description: The name of the this user.

contactID.description: A pointer to the unique identifier for this user's full contact record.

npn.description: The number established by the NAIC and given to an individual agent during the licensing process.

boundParties.description: A collection of the parties that this user is directly bound to.  Each bound party is a either a role that the user directly holds (e.g. an individual agent or policyowner), or an organization that the user is a representative of (e.g. an agency or company).

agencyIDs.description: A collection of pointers to the full contact records of agencies that this user is affiliated with.

carriers.description: A collection of carriers that this user is affiliated with.

capabilities.description: A collection of permissions that this user is authorized to.

schema.description: A collection of users.

users.description:
The collection of users that this user is authorized to view, and/or impersonate.
Some users are authorized to view, and/or impersonate other users based on carrier hierarchy logic.

partyBindings.description: A normalized collection of party bindings that this user is holds. Party bindings grant a user access to a particular set of records, in accordance with the carrier's access hierarchy rules.

partyID.description: A pointer to the full contact record for this party binding.

linkedParties.description:
A collection of parties that this user is linked to via carrier authorization logic. 
Each linked party is one which the user is authorized to view or impersonate. 
Note: A user’s collection of linked parties includes their bound parties (parties which the user can directly act as).

aggregations.description:
A set of aggregations generated from the search results, as requested by the user. 
NOTE: This object consists of a dynamically assigned array, returning any aggregations the user requests at run-time.

totalCount.description: The total number of search results (i.e. records) that match the search criteria. The `totalCount` can be used for determining pagination needs.

A set of aggregations generated from the search results, as requested by the user. 
NOTE: This object consists of a dynamically assigned array, returning any aggregations the user requests at run-time.

A set of aggregations generated from the search results, as requested by the user. 
NOTE: This object consists of a dynamically assigned array, returning any aggregations the user requests at run-time.

totalCount.description: The total number of search results (i.e. records) that match the search criteria. The `totalCount` can be used for determining pagination needs.

results.description: The collection of users and linked parties that this user is authorized to view, and/or impersonate.

resourceType.description: The type of resource this record represents.

userNumber.description: A combination of letters and numbers that the carrier uses to uniquely identify this user.

resourceType.description: The type of resource this record represents.

boundUsers.description: The collection of users that are bound to this party. These are the users that can act as, on behalf of, or as a representative of this party.

userNumber.description: A combination of letters and numbers that the carrier uses to uniquely identify this user.

capabilities.description: A collection of permissions that are enabled for this bound user.

A set of aggregations generated from the search results, as requested by the user.
NOTE: This object consists of a dynamically assigned array, returning any aggregations the user requests at run-time.

totalCount.description: The total number of search results (i.e. records) that match the search criteria. The `totalCount` can be used for determining pagination needs.

query.description: The query defining how a given search will be performed. Consists of one or more filters.

operator.description: A logical operator used to combine filters.

filters.description:
A collection of filters making up the overall `query`. Filters include:

- **Value Existence Filter**: Returns either records that _have_ a value in this field, or records that _does not have_ a value in this field.
  - NOTE: Since this filter reports only on the existence/non-existence of data, no user-specified `value` is required.

- **Numeric Comparison Filter**: Returns records based on whether the data in a given numerical field does/does not match, does/does not contain,or is  greater/less than a particular user-specified numerical `value`.

- **String Comparison Filter**: Returns records based on whether the data in a given string field does/does not match, does/does not contain, or starts/ends with a particular user-specified string `value`.

- **Date Comparison Filter**: Returns records based on whether data in a given date field comes before/after a user-specified date `value`.

- **List Membership Filter**: Returns records based on whether the data in a given field matches/does not match _at least one value_ in a set of user-specified `values`, similar to a logical "OR" filter.

- **Range Filter**: Returns records based on whether the data in a given numerical or data field exist within/outside of a given range.

- **Resource Type Filter**: Returns records based on whether the data in a given field matches a user-specified business object type (e.g. policy, case, user).

- **Composite Filter**: Bundles multiple filters together under a single logical operator (AND or OR). It returns records that satisfy this entire combination of filters.
  - NOTE: This is how you build complex, nested queries. For example, you can create a structure like `(condition1 AND condition2) OR (condition3 AND condition4)`.

- **Search Filter**: Returns records based on whether the data in a given field matches the user-specified search terms. Terms can be searched either as individual words, or as a phrase (contiguous string).

aggregations.description: A collection of data aggregations the user has chosen to apply to the search results. Each aggregation summarizes, visualizes, or otherwise processes the search results for data analysis purposes.
